Description: Temple beside the Nile; landscape with ruins of a temple, with river Nile, boats and palm trees behind the ruins, and a camel and figures sitting at rest on the sand in the foreground Watercolour
Producer name: Formerly attributed to: John E Ferneley
Curator's comments: The present drawing (along with 1935.0103.7 to 24) was inserted in sketchbook 1935,0103.6(1-8) but these drawings did not form part of its original contents, so were registered as separate drawings. The style and subject matter of this landscape make it unlikely to be by Fernley (neither John Ferneley Sr or Jr nor Claude Ferneley visited Egypt) so it will be stored with unmounted anonymous drawings, period VII.
Funder name: Funded by: H L Florence Fund
Acquisition notes: Letters received in 1934 from Backus to A. M. Hind, the Keeper of the Department of Print & Drawings at that time, record that Backus acquired this group of drawings by Ferneley from a friend of the artist, who gave them to him directly.
